name: BBC
caseStudyText: Scrubbable is a novel way of allowing a user to control the flow of a short, high frame rate video clip.

challenge.description: We needed to turn large, high quality videos into single images, super-quickly, and in a super performent fashion

hurdles.title: Turning an idea into reality
hurdles.text: Expanding on an original concept, we needed to create a production ready Scrubbable tool to be used across the BBC real estate in any number of ways, under extreme usage stress.

hurdles.title: Tiny payload capacity
hurdles.text: We needed to reduce the file size down massively, to allow our entire application and video to be under a 500mb library download.

hurdles.title: Making it smooth, and obvious
hurdles.text: We worked hard to make sure the interactions were obvious, intuitive and fun - meaning anyone can Scrub quickly and easily.

solution.description: We used image processing to present single frames each side of the users current time frame, all controlled by touch - or scrubbing

hurdles.title: Continual optimisation of libraries and code
hurdles.text: We needed to continually re-imagine our technical approaches to create a highly optimised and performant experience for usage and CMS upload. We removed all large libraries (Angular, jQuery), replacing with either vanilla JS or micro libraries, greatly reducing the download needed.

hurdles.title: Responsive image resolution / download
hurdles.text: We worked hard to deliver a responsive solution to handling and presenting imagery, enabling device specific presentation of images for performance.

hurdles.title: CMS controlled Scrubs
hurdles.text: We created a simple, bespoke CMS to allow editorial to control video frame-rates and thus total image downloads.

results.description: One of the most successful BBC iWonder tools ever, Scrubbable has been used extensively for the 2014 World Cup, Bitesize, Comedy and loads more.
